meanings.definition: The state of being alone or solitary.
meanings.sent1: Her loneliness was palpable as she sat by herself at lunch.
meanings.sent2: The old man's loneliness was evident in his empty house.
meanings.sent3: The loneliness of the abandoned teddy bear made the children feel sorry for it.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the cave echoed with the loneliness of the explorer.
meanings.sent5: The loneliness of the howling wind in the empty field was haunting.

meanings.definition: The feeling of sadness or distress caused by being alone.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the loneliness that enveloped her after her friends left.
meanings.sent2: His heart ached with loneliness when he realized he had no one to talk to.
meanings.sent3: The loneliness of the abandoned puppy tugged at her heartstrings.
meanings.sent4: The loneliness in her eyes mirrored the pain in her soul.
meanings.sent5: The loneliness in the empty room was suffocating.
